techs.name: Emerge
techs.quote: The world has turned, fallen, turned, broken, turned, and began to heal. It is time to try again.

techs.name: Sailing
techs.quote: 'He who commands the sea has command of everything.' - Themistocles

techs.name: Movable Type
techs.quote: Language, and even writing have persisted through the fall. Efficient replication of written works will nonetheless improve both culture and science.

techs.name: Crop Rotation
techs.quote: The old world would change the crops planted each season to improve soil health and crop yields. Re-learning what crops use what nutrients will improve agricultural yields.

techs.name: Scrap Repurposing
techs.quote: The fall left large volumes of functional materials in relitively acessable locations. By studying their makeup, their repurposing will become effective at scale.

techs.name: Calendar
techs.quote: 'So teach us to number our days, so that we may apply our hearts unto wisdom.' - Bible Psalms 90:12

techs.name: Writing
techs.quote: 'He who destroys a good book kills reason itself.' - John Milton

techs.name: Selective Breeding
techs.quote: Much fauna survived the fall. They posess some traits that render them unsuitable for domestic use which must be removed.

techs.name: The Wheel
techs.quote: 'Wisdom and virtue are like the two wheels of a cart.' - Japanese proverb

techs.name: Masonry
techs.quote: 'How happy are those whose walls already rise!' - Virgil

techs.name: Bronze Working
techs.quote: 'Here Hector entered, with a spear eleven cubits long in his hand; the bronze point gleamed in front of him, and was fastened to the shaft of the spear by a ring of gold.' - Homer
